summary: This is a letter from Apple Inc.'s Privacy & Law Enforcement Compliance team to the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York, responding to a legal request (Case Number 2019R01059) received on August 13, 2019. Apple is providing encrypted data files (APL000001 through APL000004) containing customer information from a 12-month search, with technical instructions for decryption.

persons.name: Ian
persons.role: Apple Privacy & Law Enforcement Compliance representative
persons.context: The signatory of the letter from Apple Inc. responding to a legal request from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The recipient of the letter at the United States Attorney's Office in New York, to whom Apple is providing data in response to a legal request.

connections.description: Ian, representing Apple's compliance team, is formally responding to a legal data request from the AUSA.

events.title: Legal request received by Apple
events.description: Apple received a legal request from law enforcement, prompting the data search and production.

events.title: Apple's data production response
events.description: Apple sent encrypted data files (APL000001-APL000004) to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to the legal request.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Apple Inc. produced data files (APL000001 through APL000004) in response to a legal request from the U.S. Attorney's Office, case number 2019R01059.
The data covers a 12-month period and was encrypted using GPG software for security, with the password sent separately.
The legal request was received by Apple on August 13, 2019, and the response was sent on September 19, 2019.
Apple notes that IP addresses starting with '17.' or '10.' in connection logs reflect internal Apple server activity, not user connections.
Evidence preservation responsibility for the produced data lies with the requesting law enforcement agency.
